channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mattress in front garden. Been there for more than a week, 6th October
item.description:
No 67 Norfolk Road. Abandoned mattress in front garden, been there for a week or more. This constitutes a fire risk especially with Fireworks now in the shops. Please ask the resident to deal with this with due haste.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norfolk Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building waste left on pavement, 6th October
item.description:
Some building waste has been unloaded onto the pavement against the wall. It is opposite number 19 Eglinton Hill. It looks like several buckets of rubble and old wood and some rotten wooden boards. From memory, it was not there in the morning of Wednesday 1st October, but was there by morning Thursday 2nd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eglinton Hill, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree too big branches keep falling off, 6th October
item.description:
The tree in the photo is in the green between 16 terrace houses. Over the years it has grown too big for the area it is in. In recent years over the winter time with poor weather conditions we get a lot of large branches breaking off, a few weeks ago one came down and took out some telephone lines, and this past weekend the wind brought down yet another branch and it hasnt been that windy yet. My concern is due to the size of the tree and its location close to 8 of the houses (all of them are privately owned except for two) that if a larger branch comes down then it will do serious damage to the property. I believe that the tree needs to be pruned rather heavily to avoid anything happening to damage our properties. Please can you review this request and take action to future proof nothing serious happening in the future.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dittisham Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
